cit:title.gco:CharacterString: Canadian Integrated Ocean Observing System Metadata Profile of ISO 19115
Ancient Forest Wetlands, BC - Upper Fraser River - 2019 - Airborne Coastal Observatory

lan:textGroup.xlink:title: text translated using the Amazon translate service / texte traduit l'aide du service de traduction Amazon
lan:textGroup.lan:LocalisedCharacterString: Ancient Forest Wetlands, BC - Haut Fraser - 2019 - Observatoire ctier aroport

mri:abstract.gco:CharacterString:
Ancient Forest Wetlands Survey conducted on Aug 29th 2019. Contained within this report are details regarding the project specifications, overall data accuracy, and deliverables. A survey acquisition of LiDAR and orthoimagery was carried out over Ancient Forest/Chun T'Oh Whudujut Provincial Park to generate a high-res DEM of several wetland complexes and their surrounding topography. The DEM is being used to support a project mapping the hydraulic gradient throughout the year in the wetlands in an effort to determine how significant snowmelt recharge is for these ecosystems. Hakai Institutes Airborne Coastal Observatory (Hakai ACO) conducted an aerial survey of 14.95km2 approximately 93km south-east of the Prince George Airport over the Ancient Forest / Chun Toh Whudujut Provincial park. The survey commenced on Aug 29th 2019 and finished on the same date. Data collected includes: LiDAR, 4 band digital imagery, and Inertial Navigation System (INS) data Using combined GNSS and Inertial Movement Unit (IMU) data, the Hakai geospatial group calculated aircraft attitude and position, and incorporated laser range data to resolve spatial surface information. The flight consisted of 8 parallel passes over the Ancient Forest/ Chun Toh Whudujut Provincial Park and the INS positional data was processed immediately after the completion of the project. Previous calibration flights allowed Hakais geospatial group to calibrate the roll, pitch, and heading of the system and refine the acquired spatial data. Aircraft position data was processed using an Applanix CenterPoint RTX solution by combining multiple continuous operating GNSS base stations to generate a set of observations as base stations to post-process Differential GNSS processing. The aerial survey combined with previously flown calibration flights aided in resolving and validating vertical elevations and geo-referenced aerial photos. Hakai Institutes geospatial team completed all data acquisition, data post-processing and quality analysis.
Geodetic Parameters Horizontal Datum: NAD83 (CSRS) Epoch: 2010.00 Vertical Datum: CGVD2013 Geoid: CGG2013a Projection: UTM Zone 10 N Units: Metres Point Specification Aggregated Nominal Point Density (ANPD): 7.3 pts/m2 Aggregated Nominal Ground Point Density (ANGPD): 2.71pts/m2 Orthophoto Resolution: 7.4 cm pixel resolution
Data products available: Lidar data (LAZ)- classified point cloud digital surface model digital terrain model. Image data (TIFF) 4 band orthophotos RGB & NIR. Hyperspectral data (not always captured). A detailed project report with the summary of acquisition, processing, and overall hardware / software is available (PDF). Sensors and instrument breakdown: Inertial Navigation System: Manufacturer: Applanix (Canada), IMU Model: POS AV 510 IMAR, GNSS Model: Trimble AV39. Laser sensor: Riegl LMS-Q 780 long-range airborne laser scanner. Point density ranges per project and landscape from 1-12 points per square meter. Aerial cameras: two fully integrated Phaseone Industrial iXU-RS1000 medium format cameras, resolution: 100MP, lens: 50mm f/4.0 Rodenstock. Hyperspectral Sensor: manufacturer: Specim, model: AisaFENIX 384, spectral range: 380 - 2500 nm

lan:textGroup.lan:LocalisedCharacterString:
Enqute sur les zones humides des forts anciennes ralise le 29 aot 2019. Contenu de ce rapport sont des dtails concernant les spcifications du projet, l'exactitude globale des donnes et les livrables. Une acquisition de LiDAR et d'ortho-imagerie a t ralise sur Ancient Le parc provincial Forest/Chun T'Oh Whudujut va gnrer un MNT haute rsolution de plusieurs zones humides complexes et leur topographie environnante. Le DEM est utilis pour soutenir un projet cartographier le gradient hydraulique tout au long de l'anne dans les zones humides afin de dterminer l'importance de la recharge de la fonte des neiges pour ces cosystmes. L'observatoire ctier aroport du Hakai Institute (Hakai ACO) a effectu un lev arien d'une superficie de 14,95 km2, environ 93 km au sud-est de l'aroport de Prince George au-dessus de l'Ancient Fort/parc provincial Chun T'oh Whudujut. L'enqute a dbut le 29 aot 2019 et termin la mme date. Les donnes collectes comprennent: LiDAR, imagerie numrique 4 bandes et Donnes du systme de navigation inertielle (INS) En utilisant les donnes combines GNSS et Inertial Movement Unit (IMU), le gospatial de Hakai groupe a calcul l'assiette et la position de l'aronef, et a incorpor des donnes de porte laser informations spatiales sur la surface. Le vol a consist en 8 passages parallles au-dessus de l'Ancient Forest/ Le parc provincial Chun T'oh Whudujut et les donnes de position de l'INS ont t traites immdiatement. aprs l'achvement du projet. Les vols d'talonnage prcdents ont permis la gospatiale de Hakai pour calibrer le roulis, le tangage et le cap du systme et affiner l'espace acquis donnes. Les donnes de position de l'avion ont t traites l'aide d'une solution Applanix CenterPoint RTX par combinant plusieurs stations de base GNSS fonctionnant en continu pour gnrer un ensemble de observations en tant que stations de base pour post-traiter le traitement GNSS diffrentiel. L'antenne relev combin des vols d'talonnage prcdemment effectus pour aider rsoudre et valider lvations verticales et photos ariennes gorfrences. L'quipe gospatiale du Hakai Institute a ralis toutes les acquisitions de donnes, le post-traitement des donnes et analyse de la qualit.
Paramtres godsiques Date horizontale: NAD83 (CSRS) poque: 2010.00 Date verticale: CGVD2013 Gode: CGG2013a Projection: Zone UTM 10 N Units: Mtres Spcification du point Densit en points nominaux agrgs (ANDP): 7,3 pts/m2 Densit nominale au point sol agrge (ANGDP): 2,71 pts/m2 Rsolution Orthophoto: rsolution de 7,4 cm en pixels
Produits de donnes disponibles: Donnes Lidar (LAZ) - nuage de points classifis - modle de surface numrique - modle numrique de terrain. Donnes d'image (TIFF) orthophotos 4 bandes RGB et NIR. Donnes hyperspectrales (pas toujours captures). Un rapport de projet dtaill avec le rsum de l'acquisition, du traitement et de l'ensemble du matriel/logiciel est disponible (PDF). Panne des capteurs et des instruments: Systme de navigation inertie: Fabricant: Applanix (Canada), modle IMU: POS AV 510 IMAR, modle GNSS: Trimble AV39. Capteur laser: scanner laser aroport longue porte Riegl LMS-Q 780. La densit de points par projet et paysage varie de 1 12 points par mtre carr. Camras ariennes: deux appareils photo moyen format Phaseone Industrial iXU-RS1000 entirement intgrs, rsolution: 100MP, objectif: 50mm f/4.0 Rodenstock. Capteur hyperspectral: fabricant: Specim, modle: AisaFenix 384, plage spectrale: 380 - 2500 nm

mcc:description.gco:CharacterString: EPSG::5829 - Instantaneous Water Level height - Height relative to instantaneous water level uncorrected for tide. Not specific to any location or epoch.
